intro: Kuhlhasseltia, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Aizoaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where they thrive in rocky and arid environments. Kuhlhasseltia species are characterized by their succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, dandelion-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. They are often found growing on rocky outcrops and in coastal areas, adapting to harsh, dry conditions. Due to their unique appearance and habitat, they are popular among succulent enthusiasts and botanists studying xerophytic adaptations.
